title: Automobile exports from India dip 5.5% in FY24
description: India's automobile exports fell by 5.5% in FY24 due to global monetary crises, with overall exports totaling 45,00,492 units. SIAM President Vinod Aggarwal cited volatile overseas markets and foreign exchange issues. While commercial vehicles, two-wheelers, and three-wheelers declined, passenger vehicles marginally increased. Recovery in Jan-Mar signals better prospects ahead.
